author: Danny Schwartz
title: The Underachievers - Gotham Nights
text:
0 MAKE IT STOP The Underachievers release "Gotham Nights," from their upcoming project "Renaissance." 
The Underachievers ' 2016 mixtape It Happened in Flatbush departed from the psychedelic realm of their 2015 album Evermore - The Art of Duality to the land of bangers. It appears that the Brooklyn duo is about to take another right turn. They have announced a new project called Renaissance and released its first track, "Gotham Nights." 
Produced by Joshua Heflinger, "Gotham Nights" is a nostalgic tribute to '90s New York City rap. The Underachievers offer a humble prayer that a higher power will keep them "segregated from haters." 
Listen to the song while in a car, or while on a subway train trundling over the Williamsburg Bridge at dusk.
